coded_answer.p: I'm writing to you because of the musical show "Over the rainbow", wichwhich I visitedsaw on Friday the 16th of June in your theatre. There are several points I have to complain about wichwhich mademeant the evening was not nice at all.

At firstFirst the show started much later than it was written outadvertised. Instead of half past seven the show startetstarted at quarter past eight. I couldn't go to haveget aany refreshment because offor two reasons, the first one is that there was no information about how much timelong the start of the show iswas going to be late by. The second reason is that the restaurant of the theatretheatre restaurant was closed because of building plans for the next two monthfor the next two months because of building plans.

After I waited for about 45 minutes the show suddenly started but I had to realizerealised that the main actor Danny Brook, who was the reason why I went intoto the show, had been tradedreplaced by an otheranother actor, who couldn't sing as half as goodwell thenas Brook.
On your tickettickets information is written out that discounts are available, when I askasked at the ticket receptionoffice I couldn't get any discount for beengbeing a student.
To make an resultconclude, the evening in your theatre and the show was very disappointing and not like the one promised. For these reasons I want to ask you to getfor my money, of Â£25, back.

Unfortunately, Pat wasn't very good at keeping secrets. He didn't want to say what Sarah just hadhad just told him, it just came overout of his mouth, when he talked to James. "Sarah has won in a quiz show?" James was more than just interested, he wanted to know what she had won. But Pat made a promise not to tell anybody about the quiz show and he already hadhad already told enough.

After one hour the hohlewhole class had heard about Sarah's secret. Everybody was interested in what she had won but knowbodynobody wanted to ask Sarah because it was told inas a secret to them. Sarah realized that everybody was nice and friendly to her but something was going on in the class, when she turned around a talking and wisperingwhispering started. Suddenly, she went to Pat and asked him did, "Did you tell anybody about our secret.?" Pat told her everything. Sarah looked at him for a while, thanthen she stood in front of the class and explaindexplained to the others, that she wonhad won a prize for 20 people to travel for 1 week to the seacoast of southern France and everybodyevery one of the 19 pupils was invited, except Pat who wasn't very good at keeping secrets.
